page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: Farms in this block tend to divide their time between raising dairy cattle (80%) and growing arable crops, particularly Cheshire potatoes.There is some farming of silage on a commercial scale. The dairy cattle are Friesians, although recently,Jersey and Guernsey cattle,which produce richer milk,have been introduced. The changes in E.E.C. milk quotas have caused considerable hardship to many farms with bankruptcy and amalgamation of small uneconomic farms becoming increasingly common. The production of arable crops however, seems to be on the increase, and shows a profit. Potatoes,carrots, sprouts,cabbage and cauliflowers are grown on the sandy not too fertile soils where care of the crops is easy. The potatoes are transported in bulk to markets throughout the country.
